intro: Cussonia bequaertii, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Cussonia bequaertii is valued for its ornamental foliage and has some traditional uses in local communities.
